reg:regulation.reg:title: Wildlife Management Area Use and Access Regulation
reg:regulation.reg:amsincluded: [includes amendments up to B.C. Reg. 111/2019, May 29, 2019]

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: No camping in designated wildlife management areas
bcl:section.bcl:text: A person commits an offence if the person enters a wildlife management area described in Schedule 1 in order to do one or both of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: set up a tent or other shelter.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: No campfires in designated wildlife management areas
bcl:section.bcl:text: A person commits an offence if the person enters a wildlife management area described in Schedule 2 in order to do one or more of the following for a recreational purpose:

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: No dogs in designated wildlife management areas in March or April
bcl:section.bcl:text: A person commits an offence if the person enters a wildlife management area, or a portion of a wildlife management area, described in Schedule 3 with a dog
in any calendar year.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Dogs must be on leash in designated wildlife management areas

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person commits an offence if the person enters a wildlife management area described in Schedule 4 with a dog that is not

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: under the direct control of a person, and
restrained by a leash not longer than 2 metres.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: This section does not apply to a person who enters the wildlife management area in order to engage in lawful hunting.

bcl:section.bcl:text: Effective year round, in that portion of M.U. 1-13 as shown on the attached Map No. 1-1.

bcl:schedule.bcl:schedulesubtitle: No Dogs in March or April

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Parksville-Qualicum Beach Wildlife Management Area — portions
bcl:section.bcl:text: The following portions of the Parksville-Qualicum Beach Wildlife Management Area:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the intertidal zone, from the mean high water mark to the mean low water mark, contained within the area located from that point of land at the end of Doehle Avenue extending in an easterly direction for approximately 2.5 km to the mouth of the Englishman River;

the intertidal zone, from the mean high water mark to the mean low water mark, contained within the area located from that point of land at the end of Seacrest Place extending in an easterly direction for approximately 3.5 km to the mouth of French Creek;

the intertidal zone, from the mean high water mark to the mean low water mark, contained within the area located from that point of land at the end of Seacroft Road extending in a westerly direction for approximately 2 km to the mouth of the Little Qualicum River.

bcl:section.bcl:text: Effective year round, in that portion of M.U. 1-13 as shown on the attached Map No. 4-1.
Effective year round, in that portion of M.U. 1-5 as shown on the attached Map No. 4-2.

bcl:lefttext.in:em: Maps are exempt from publication and may be inspected at the offices of the Ministry of Forests, Lands and Natural Resource Operations, 2975 Jutland Road, Victoria, B.C. V8T 5J9, during regular office hours.

reg:content.reg:provisionsnote: [Provisions relevant to the enactment of this regulation: Wildlife Act, R.S.B.C. 1996, c. 488, ss. 108 and 109.]
